metadata.title: CVE-2020-35513 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
A flaw incorrect umask during file or directory modification in the Linuxkernel NFS (network file system) functionality was found in the way usercreate and delete object using NFSv4.2 or newer if both simultaneouslyaccessing the NFS by the other process that is not using new NFSv4.2. Auser with access to the NFS could use this flaw to starve the resourcescausing denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-35513` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-23-generic - 4.15.0-23.25
linux-image-4.15.0-23-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-23.25
linux-image-4.15.0-23-lowlatency - 4.15.0-23.25
linux-image-4.15.0-23-snapdragon - 4.15.0-23.25
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-23-generic - 4.15.0-23.25
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-23-lowlatency - 4.15.0-23.25
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-23.25').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1011.11').
